
{{alias}}( x, y )
    Computes the dot product of two double-precision floating-point vectors.

    Arguments which are not 1-dimensional ndarrays containing double-precision
    floating-point numbers are **unsafely** cast to 1-dimensional ndarrays.

    For best performance, provide 1-dimensional ndarrays containing double-
    precision floating-point numbers.

    If provided empty vectors, the function returns `0.0`.

    Parameters
    ----------
    x: ndarray|ArrayLikeObject
        First input array.

    y: ndarray|ArrayLikeObject|
        Second input array.

    Returns
    -------
    dot: number
        The dot product of `x` and `y`.

    Examples
    --------
    > var x = {{alias:@stdlib/ndarray/array}}( new {{alias:@stdlib/array/float64}}( [ 4.0, 2.0, -3.0, 5.0, -1.0 ] ) );
    > var y = {{alias:@stdlib/ndarray/array}}( new {{alias:@stdlib/array/float64}}( [ 2.0, 6.0, -1.0, -4.0, 8.0 ] ) );
    > {{alias}}( x, y )
    -5.0

    See Also
    --------
